DOC.brief_summary: Physical activity is a well-known and powerful tool in medicine,having preventive, palliative, and curative properties. This has not been sufficiently examined in children in remission from cancer. In this study, children in remission from cancer will be divided into exercise and control groups. The interventional group will perform two supervised, 60-minute weekly exercise sessions. Outcome measures of the exercise intervention will be quality of life, mood, cardiorespiratory fitness, body composition and bone mineral density.
DOC.brief_title: Physical Activity and Health of Children With Cancer in Remission
DOC.criteria: children aged 616 remission from cancer >6 months after completion of all therapy informed consent not given in writing refusal of tests: blood, fitness, questionnaires or DEXA locomotive handicaps extreme fatigue, nausea, dyspnea concurrent acute illness recent (less than 3 months) hospitalization documented (echocardiographic or nuclear medicine) decrease in cardiac function abnormal blood tests: Hb < 10 gr/dl, neutropenia < 500/mm3, thrombocytopenia < 50,000/mm3 additional chronic health conditions unrelated to cancer (e.g. celiac disease, cerebral palsy, Down's syndrome)
